pages.text: Fractures on the hud are represented by a sleeve on the upper and lower border of the posture bar. It begins green but progresses to red as the combatant gets closer to being exposed.
pages.title: Fractures[0]

pages.text: $(l)"Posture Break"$()$(br)When a combatant's posture is emptied by posture damage they will take a $(#CCCC00)"fracture"$(). $(br2)Fractures are a mark of combat damage and exhaustion. A combatant's max fractures is typically determined by max health, and increased by armor.

Players start with 3 by default; this lets your posture empty 3 times before you're in severe danger. Most normal player sized mobs will have one to two.$(br2)At the time of being fractured a combatant will also suffer one of 3 levels of debilitating combat states depending on their condition. These are covered in the other related pages.

Combatants are encouraged not to flee combat when fractured, however, as the simple act of defying your opponent and defeating them will immediately cure you of all fractures you've suffered from them. Being exposed also resets your fractures. $(br2)If you really must escape from a fight: enemies who have despawned or become unloaded are also counted as gone, and upon killing another mob those "unowned" fractures will cease to ail you.
